sentence: Fuentes, a white nationalist who celebrated the attack in its aftermath, notably hosted Rep. Paul Gosar (R-Ariz.) as a keynote speaker at a conference last year, just weeks after the attack.
title: Jan. 6 investigators subpoena far-right figures who promoted election fraud claims

sentence: The Anti-Defamation League describes Fuentes as “a white supremacist leader and organizer and podcaster who seeks to forge a white nationalist alternative to the mainstream GOP.” Fuentes is the leader of the so-called Groyper Army and notably hosted Rep. Paul Gosar (R-AZ) as a keynote speaker at a far-right conference he held last year as counter-programming to CPAC.
author: Alex Griffing
title: House Jan. 6 Committee Subpoenas Far-Right ‘Groypers’ Nick Fuentes and Patrick Casey

sentence: Reps. Paul Gosar, R-Ariz., and Ted Cruz, R-Texas, were also named in the subpoena as two of "more than 100" members of Congress who were "on board" with the plans to overturn the election results.
author: Chelsey Cox
title: Peter Navarro, former Trump White House adviser, subpoenaed by Jan. 6 committee

author: Bob Brigham
title: Jan. 6 committee reveals why it subpoenaed RNC fundraising records

author: Luke Broadwater
title: Ivanka Trump Testifies to House Panel Investigating Jan. 6 Attack

sentence: But traditional dynamics in the House have already begun to shift — consider how Democrats kicked Rep. Majorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) off her committees over past comments, or censured and removed Rep. Paul Gosar (R-Ariz.) from his assignments after he promoted an animated video depicting violence against Democrats, including President Biden.
author: Brigid Kennedy
title: House GOP reportedly considering term limits for all committee leaders
